fields.summary: fsck should also report decommissioning replicas.

fields.summary: Revert the incompatible fsck reporting output in HDFS-7933 from branch-2.7

comments.body: [~zhz], I'm pushing for a 2.7.4, can you explain why it has to be reverted?
+1 for reverting HDFS-7933 since it has changed the output format of hdfs fsck command.

Per latest discussion under HDFS-7933, repurposing this JIRA to revert the incompatible fsck output (but keep the calculation logic behind decommissioning and decommissioned replicas).

[~ajisakaa], [~vinodkv] LMK if the above plan sounds good.
Sounds good. Thanks [~zhz].
Attaching v00 patch to revert {{NamenodeFsck}} and {{TestFsck}}.

Thanks [~brahmareddy] for taking a look. Yes you are right, that output should only be decommissioned. Attaching v01 patch to fix it.

I also verified that none of the reported unit test failures could be reproduced locally.

As for whether we should add the HDFS-7933 fsck output as a configurable option, [~ajisakaa] [~vinodkv] [~shv] any opinions?

This message was automatically generated.

??whether we should add the HDFS-7933 fsck output as a configurable option??

I don't think we should have it configurable. This will create problems going forward to 2.8 and trunk, if they wont have the option. So just restoring the output for 2.7.4 sounds good to me.

Thanks for confirming [~shv].

I verified reported unit test failures and couldn't reproduce them locally. {{TestDecommissioningStatus}} is potentially related but I couldn't reproduce the failure after running locally for 20+ times. Just triggered Jenkins again. I suspect the reason is that during the [Jenkins run | https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/19801/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode/TestDecommissioningStatus/testDecommissionStatus/] of the unit test, one DN in the minicluster was having issue so one more block was considered under-replicated.
